title: Riot is keeping the current rune page system just so they won't have to refund rune pages.
body:
> [{quoted}](name=Riot Cactopus,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=RlNQkO39,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-07-20T17:42:04.247+0000)
>
> But what about rune pages, you ask? The plan is for your rune pages to carry over into the new runes system, so prices on rune pages aren't being changed and they won't be refunded. The difference is you'll be able to edit them in champ select. 

fucking lmao

replies.body:
This is actually pretty bad. Rune pages are the most expensive, yet less satisfying thing to buy in the shop. And it's mandatory to have them. Now that they are fleshing out such a complex system with more options, inevitably more rune pages will be required. 

Example: I have 19 different mastery pages (and for good reasons), while 7 rune pages suffice. Since this system will be closer to keystone's rather than stat advantages, I assume I will be forced to buy lots of pages.
you can edit rune pages in champ select with the new system, so you dont need to buy any

Generally Yes
But Mastery Pages are also editable
And how many of those do you have?
Of course, those are free, but presets are nice
Presets are ***nice***, but not required. I would not buy the option to have an additional preset with RP, that would be an IP only purchase.
No, they are keeping it because it is a profitable system that  limits influx of IP for newer players which promps them to by RP to get champions or rune pages. Ghost Crawler said so himself

Except you can edit rune pages in champ select, so there is no reason to buy rune pages ever.

It will just be a noob trap that is more likely to lose them customers after realizing they have been scammed than anything else.

You don't need to buy them.
You have the option to if you want more presets.
It wouldn't be the first time players spent money on this game for no actual in game advantage.

Except you dont need more mastery pages currently, because you can change them on the fly. Yet they still let us make as many presets as we want. 

That is a direct comparison, except they are charging for having multiple presets when previously we could do it for free (for Masteries).
Please provide an actual link to the quote, all you are doing is spreading false information to demonize an individual

Am I now?

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/RlNQkO39-buying-runes-between-now-and-preseason?comment=0043
Rekt.
Checkmate

Did you read the post you linked?

He says they profit on runes through the means you mentioned above, but they are changing the system anyways. He literally says "Overall, Riot is losing money on this deal.", and then goes on to talk about rune pages, where he says "If we thought that Rune Pages made no sense with the new design and risked feeling like a cash grab, we would absolutely just kill them as a feature. But we have found they are useful with Runes Reforged, just less mandatory than they were before. Definitely open to discussion on this topic however." 

At no point does Ghost Crawler say they are keeping rune pages the same to make riot money, in fact, he directly rebuts the claim.

Haha...yeah sure buddy. Read it again. He says they will make less money with the new system compared to the current one, but their goal is to make money from it still. ( which in itself is not evil or anything like that)

Where does he say that? Quote a part of his post where he is talking about rune pages so I can see it. I want to trust that you are just seeing something I'm not, but I've reread it about 15 times and I don't see where he says anything about the rune pages being kept to make Riot money.

I'm not saying Riot isn't making the decision for that reason, but Ghost Crawler doesn't say that they are.
The whole first paragraph specifically, although most of the post talks about the economic reasons behind rune pages. How old are you?
Bringing out the age, classic.
Are you implying that these evil bastards expect new accounts to have to spend REAL MONEY to get things quickly in this game? WHAT THE UFCK I THOUGHT RITO WAS A REGISTERED CHARITY
Lol, my thoughts exactly! People are getting way too worked up over this.

hah what bullshit.

''but you do make 20 mastery pages''
yeah because it's free, if mastery pages also costed IP I would just have 1 mastery page and change that every champion select

> [{quoted}](name=hhaavviikk,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QUw0MEzT,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2017-07-21T14:12:10.021+0000)
>
> hah what bullshit.
> 
> ''but you do make 20 mastery pages''
> yeah because it's free, if mastery pages also costed IP I would just have 1 mastery page and change that every champion select

I do this already. Like, there's very little variety on what you can choose mastery wise anyway. Takes like 4 seconds to change.

Rune pages lost completely it's value and turned into complete shenanigans.

You can change runes during the champion select now, so there is absolute no value to have more than 1 rune page.

The entire goal of having a rune page was the fact you could not change it anyway.

If they do that to not refund our rune pages shit will get real.

Yeah but why do we have 20 mastery pages then? So that you can save them without having to change them all the time. I will personally enjoy  this. And before anybody else gives me shit, I own every single rune in the game and I don't care if I get anything refunded or not. Why should I get mad? Because I was not smart enough to buy stuff I actually want or need? Well, silly me. Not Riot's fault, they just offer the option. Nobody ever forced you to buy multiple rune pages and considering they are just at the cost of a champion.. what gives?

The mastery pages have a long list of variable options we can switch back and forth depending on which individual champion you were playing. You can fill ten different slots optimally , but vary from a board with over 40 different masteries to choose from. Not to mention mastery pages are free access and you can whittle yourself down to 1-2 pages if you don't need 18, and then change your mind and add more later at no cost.

Depending on how the new combined rune/mastery system plays out, we'll have 6 slots to fill, but since runes have to be obtained through IP first, people almost always just pick the ones they're going to use, and ignore the ones they don't need, meaning that the system might never give the average individual a reason to choose from more than 25 different runes. It means there are less choices to make, which means there is less time needed to make those choices.

This system of allowing people to keep their rune pages but also allowing in-game editing will only work if there are a significantly large number of available runes, and each one's worth is significant enough to warrant use on a large enough number of champions that would make people consider getting them to begin with.
The new runes will be free...

Because each champion have specific masteries, where most champions can function on similiar rune pages. For instance, my AD page is just a 9 armor seals, Some ad, with Attack speed mixed in, and magic resist. From my top lane tank to my jungle zac, it works fine most of my ad champs. (only exception is fucking nunu, but you need like 20%AT speed in rune or smth)

You have it backwards. 

There are only a few nuances between runepages, and most of them are in the cunning tree. The others are all pretty non-negotiable, even between different champs.

Meanwhile for runes, having a specific runepage for each champion, or even multiple for different scenarios, drastically increases your performance in game.

What? I know it increases your performance, but i have 2 very generic rune pages. AP and AD. Besides nunu, i havent encountered a singe champion they dont work for. Theres plenty of different ones. Some champs want regen, others want the resistance, some want to take feast and others want fresh blood for better trades, and support take expose weakness. Some want vampirism and some want natural talent.  Each champion has specific masteries, while most champions can work on a generic rune page.
Also you said rune pages instead of masteries.

Regen is better in pretty much every scenario than the %bonus resistances. 

Feast/fresh blood/expose weakness is about the only nuance in Ferocity. 

Vampirism is absolute garbage and not worth taking over natural talent in any way. Its worth putting one point into so you have SOME spellvamp/lifesteal as opposed to none, as it effectively becomes regen. Further points are inferior to your other option.

> [{quoted}](name=Siegfriedx1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QUw0MEzT,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-07-21T09:18:51.331+0000)
>
> Rune pages lost completely it's value and turned into complete shenanigans.
> 
> You can change runes during the champion select now, so there is absolute no value to have more than 1 rune page.
> 
> The entire goal of having a rune page was the fact you could not change it anyway.
> 
> If they do that to not refund our rune pages shit will get real.

This. Fucking. This.

There are a whole SIX runes to pick. I can change my runes every game. There's no reason for me to have my current 14 runepages.

I think what's goofy is that I don't see most people buying more than one page, if any pages.

If you can edit it in champ select _most people are just going to use their one page._ Like pay 6300 to avoid a minor inconvenience in setting up your runes every game or don't pay it and instead buy a new champ. The ultimate in late-game IP sinks.

Maybe. But i saw somewhere in one of the posts that came out in the last two days that Riot is currently shooting for 60 different runes on release.

Now I don't know about you but 60 runes sounds like A LOT of potential min/max optimization on a champion by champion basis to try and just cram into 2-3 standard on the fly pages.

Especially in some games when if you're playing anything other than ranked (or maybe draft) and you're struggling to decide on what champ you want. it leaves little room for totally overhauling runes when you only lock in 10 seconds until champ lock and skin select.

Well, from what we've seen, you have around 4-6 runes to pick. I don't think in a high stress situation you're going to really struggle. Beyond that, as Riot said, they want runes to be a game-by-game selection so that you can tweak your loadout before the game even starts. Which means you're best off editing your runes before anything happens. 

Extra rune pages seem like a luxury of the wealthy at this point, speaking as someone with 20.

Ehh, but they are only for convenience now. It's better to adjust the masteries for every game anyways so if you just do that you could do with 1 page. With the current rune system it's not about convenience, it's just straight up an advantage to have multiple rune pages. 

I like the changes and I am fine with the way Riot approached this although my rune pages are now useless as I have always adjusted masteries for every game.

I'm completely fine with being able to edit them (especially since they're really just masteries anyways).  I do have a bit of an issue with them using it as an excuse to give 0 compensation for purchased rune pages.  If they said, "yeah we've decided to not refund rune pages," I'd be more ok with it.  The way they are doing it just feels like they're treating us like 5 year-olds who can't understand when they're getting jipped.

Basically it feels insulting and a bit dishonest.  Especially since the rioters are pretending that there will still be value to having extra rune pages.

Darn it, they are expensive af too. I thought they would make it work the way mastery pages work since the whole original goal of this project seemed to be "let's not give players with more ip an advantage."
i dont want their to be only one rune page i want to have as many as i want.But if runes are free the rune pages should be free with them IMO wish they gave back the IP you used to buy them.
Bullshit!!!
So they're keeping them to be an IP sink but letting us change them in champ select defeating the point?
You got the point. It's called bull shit.
Rune pages are the new IP sink

This is a pretty bad choice. It's good to have the rune pages set up beforehand so you don't have to change them every game, but you can change them every game. Rune pages are still there, but significantly less useful.

I bought all of my rune pages with ip since I bought all champions (also with ip), and I like having multiple pages as I fiddle with them for a specific champion, which I won't be playing for a while and otherwise would forget that perfect combination of runes/keystones.
But I can also understand the frustration people feel when they think about all their empty rune pages with the Runes Reforged update, as you truly don't need as much when you can freely edit them in champ select.
All in all I find the change fair though, because as that rioter mentioned it is purely convenience now to buy more rune pages which makes the additional cost reasonable.

On the matter of fairness if rune pages weren't to be refunded, there is one important point people are forgetting: People say they wouldn't have bought additional rune pages if they knew they would be freely editable, but at the the time they purchased them, they WEREN'T. People bought them for a specific purpose (having competitive advantage/equality with preset runes to adapt their playstyle), that purpose will be gone, but during all the years the additional pages served their purpose well. You wouldn't try to refund your 10 year old car which runs on gasoline for the full price either, just because there is no gas left and everone is driving electric cars.

even if that's the case i dont blame them. i wouldnt want to have to refund old outdated content either. one day league is going to shut down and all of your accounts will become invalid. do you expect a refund for that as well?

just be glad they're not charging you for the updated content.
that's what people said about WoW in 2012 loool,it's still here, so will League of Legends in 10 years
wow charges for updated content AND has monthly subscription fees.

>The difference is you'll be able to edit them in champ select.

So what you're saying is that the Rune Pages I bought with RP were a 100% waste of money. Kewl. TY rito. Great business model you have here, plz make some more fizz and teemo skins, they don't have enough.

Seriously? Can't you just be happy that you'll be able to edit rune pages in champ select now? i.e. you technically don't need to buy extra rune pages anymore. And you already got your money's worth (IP's worth?) for the rune pages in the past.

Riot is not being greedy here; they aren't stealing your money or anything. You paid for rune pages in the past, you got use out of those rune pages as intended, and now the rune pages that you own are becoming more flexible. Where's the cash-grab in that?

Quit begging for more free stuff in an already free game, that gives you a free way to get their only major cash-shop items (i.e. hextech crafting gives free skins).

https://twitter.com/OccupyGStreet/status/888131839839289346 << Do you think Riot is just straight-up lying about this?
What's the point of having more than one if you can just edit them whenever you need to?
